data.title: Add underscore prefix for virtual method declaration
data.body: I have added undescode prefix for virtual methods of some classes (editor plugins, gizmo, etc) to be consistent with the rest script methods notation

data.title: Expose more methods for UndoRedo
data.body:
* set_max_steps
* get_max_steps
* redo
* undo

data.title: Spatial scrolling update + better default inertia values
data.body: `push -f` Additions the 3d navigation. ## UPDATE - adds trackpad support for 3d editor zooming. (precision trackpads... was much to fast and not scrolling speed dependant) - adds setting for zoom inertia + hints for orbit sensitivity - categorised settings: Discussion - settings naming - default values (although they are really close to what was used before. The only big change was made to: `manipulation_translation_inertia` since it was really low and you will only use manipulation (shift needs to be pressed for panning) so it was almost invisible when panning.

data.title: added editor spacing
data.body: MERGE AFTER #11207 (I again cherry picked a commit from another pr... (`fixed margin beeing squared`) if that does not work I need to drop that commit first anyways...) Removed that commit... since it isn't working. so ready to merge now. optionally adds spacing to widgets so that the editor looks cleaner (but there is less space. thats why it is an option...)

data.title: made tabs visible in debugger fixes: #11212
data.body:
- the stylebox is changed so the top part is transparent when the
   debugger is selected

the implementation is pretty damn hacky... so I don't know if it is even worth.
pseudocode how it's done
```
func switch tab:
...
    if tab is Debugger:
        sb = load and copy normal style box
        sb -> make the top expand margin negative so it fits the theme, font height...
        override bg panel style box with sb
    else:
        load stylbox from theme
...
```

data.title: Hysteresis (delay) in hierarchical dropdown menus
data.body:
I brought this up with @djrm on IRC, and he mentioned it would be easier to track here.

One thing that has bugged me for a while is the lack of a delay when hovering away from a dropdown's sub-menu option. This phenomenon is usually referred to as _hysteresis_, and this page explains it a lot better than I can: http://www.mackido.com/Interface/hysteresis.html

There aren't many places where you'll run into this problem, as there aren't many dropdown menus like this in Godot to begin with (I run into it all the time when choosing an editor layout, but that's only because Godot doesn't load the default layout correctly), but I think it's a necessary facet of UX design for desktops.

Tested with 5cb90ad (but this has affected all versions up to this point) on Linux Mint 18.2 Cinnamon x64

data.title: 3D objects should have "previews" in the filesystem
data.body:
**Issue description:**
PNG files have a preview, so it would be fitting for models to get one too. It would be better than a blank piece of paper with the corner folded, especially since the file name is often split over 2 lines. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31744099/30352870-818721da-981a-11e7-9971-206f42711e91.png)

It would also make the gui look friendlier (in my opinion at least!), which is definitely important for attracting new users
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31744099/30352989-3926ef82-981b-11e7-98e8-5ebcf5ab1443.png)

data.title: Start projects with an empty "World" node
data.body:
I don't know if it's a bug, but once I've created the first node, I can't make any more parentless nodes (in 3.0 anyway). I can't deselect all nodes in the scene hierarchy, there's no "no parent" option in the reparent GUI, and I can't drag a node outside the initial parent. 

If this is intentional, then every project must have a "world" node that holds _everything_. It would save some time to have it there already. 

If you've used Godot for a long time, then it probably would save maximum 10 seconds. But it's just "another one of those things" you have to do when you start a project. And to some people (me), workflow speed is really important, so just little things like this make a whole world of difference.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Move around in Freelook mode


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Initial project creation could be streamlined
data.body:
**Issue description:**
When you create a new project in Godot, there's a lot of time wasted messing around with the directory. The folder explorer always starts the somewhere obscure (on mine, buried a good few folders deep within the actual godot.app bundle). This also applies to any dialog prompt that requires a file to be located. 

**Example**
I really like the way Game Maker Studio deals with projects. It has a _pre-filled_ directory, pointing to documents>gamemaker>[projectname]. And that default directory can later be customized in settings.

It also creates all the assets folders for you, for your sprites, sounds, scripts, etc. But I understand people will have their own conventions, and this might be annoying. But on the flipside, standard conventions are never a bad thing to introduce. It could perhaps be an option.

**Also**
Macs have this neat feature, where you can drag a directory or a file into the load window, and it will automatically go to that path. You can't seem to do that on the Godot loading windows.

data.title: Input map broken
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
The input map doesn't allow any keyboard input other than the command keys (alt, shift, tab etc). The "Please Confirm" dialog shows the key that's pressed, but when you press ok, the slot is empty, and it doesn't respond in game.

shift+a turns into shift+
character keys don't show either (backslash, apostrophe, braceleft/right etc)

Also the mouse input shows correctly in the gui, but doesn't trigger ingame.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open a new project
Project > Project settings > Input map
Create / edit a keybind for the keyboard.
You'll see it doesn't show the bind after you press OK
write some code that does something for that keybind and compile
nothing will happen when you press it.

---------
or for mouse, create a bind for say left mouse input 0.
The GUI will show correctly in this case
Create some code that does something when you trigger that bind
nothing will happen,

data.title: Changed audio stream player property name from 'play' to 'playing'
data.body:
The audio_stream_player classes have a method and a property both named 'play'. This is somewhat confusing as the method and property do somewhat different things.

It also causes issues when generating C# code since it won't allow a property and method with the same name:
https://github.com/neikeq/GodotSharp/issues/33

Adds 3 and 4 digit html shortcuts to Color
data.body:

values by repeating each digit. This is to bring it in line with how
html handles these values

fixes #10997

data.title: [3.0] Setting negative x scale on a node with a skeleton/big hierarchy flips scale every frame.
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Win7 x64, Godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
scale = Vector2(-1, 1) flips my character every frame, alternating between 1 and -1, and it happens on the Y axis.
Using set_scale(-1, 1) does the same but on the X axis.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open example project I attached, open Stork.tscn and run that scene, check the script on the root node.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
[Stork 2, scale glitch.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1297317/Stork.2.scale.glitch.zip)

data.title: Fixed file system dialog icons
data.body: oops

data.title: [3.0] Axis invisible when light is too bright
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
If you set the brightness of a light to 16, the movement axis for an object get drowned out by the glare
http://i.imgur.com/WuD7H7T.png

The expected behavior would be that the axis are layered on top at full brightness. So the only circumstance you couldn't see them would be if the object underneath was the same color

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create an object (such as a cylinder)
Create a directional light
Set the energy to 16
Select the object
Turn the camera so you are looking at the illuminated face
The axis will disappear behind the glare.

data.title: [3.0] set_translation (and others) not in the suggestions
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Godot 3.0 

**Issue description:**
In the code editor, "set_translation" and all other similar functions don't come up in the auto complete.

**Examples:**
set_translation
get_translation
set_rotation
get_rotation
set_scale
get_scale

And probably more that I haven't learned yet
